name: Assuralia, beroepsvereniging van verzekeringsondernemingen
goal:
Assuralia, the Belgian insurance association, was established in 1920. It is the representative body for mutual, co-operative and joint-stock insurance and reinsurance companies in Belgium.
Today, it covers more than 98% of the Belgian market, i.e. currently eround 30 billion euro gross premium income (local business excluding FOS premium and reinsurance premium income).
Assuralia represents the interests of the Belgian insurers.
interests: Budget, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Employment and Social Affairs, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Information Society, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Taxation, Transport
euInitiatives: Solvency2, IDD, MiFID2, PRIIPs, IORP2, GDPR, retail financial services, Motor directive, Juncker Plan, EFSI, Resolution & Recovery, guarantee schemes, Services Directive, European Insurance Contract Law, Personal Pension Plans, Capital Markets Union, Competition issues, Anti-discrimination, AML, e-Call, C-ITS, GEAR 2030, Big Data, Re-registration, fintech, ESAs review, various EIOPA and ESMA policies.
